mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Tobias Lear on behalf of Martha Washington to President John Adams, 1799 December 31
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Martha Washingtonâ€™s draft response, written in the hand of Tobias Lear, to the proposal from Congress dated December 31, 1799, to inter George Washington in the Capitol. The letter demonstrates her feelings of loss, and the delicate balance she needed to face between the wishes of her husband, and those of the nation. Her main interest, that she be buried next to her husband, was accepted and plans proceeded for a mausoleum at the Capitol. The letter is clearly a working draft with numerous deletions and corrections. Autograph letter signed, 1 page. Related manuscript - see RM-1212.002
